intro: Berchemia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine berchemia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
